column5: At Sunset Beach in Cape May, NJ, you can see the remains of the S.S. Atlantus sticking out the Delaware Bay. The ship was one of a few experimental ships made of concrete that were built during World War I. It has been slowly receding into the bay since it snapped loose during a storm and ran aground in 1926. It has beenÂ receding into the bay ever since.
column6: The rusting remains are visible sticking out of the waters of the Delaware Bay.
column8: Cape May, New Jersey, 08204; United States
